result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin M Wellnitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Court does not oppose probation being transferrred to Green Lake.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and satisfactorily completion of any recommended treatment. Defendant shall be in some type of aftercare program unless agent states he can stop.
Maintain full time employment, school, or a combination of both.

Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers. Defendant shall be tested at least once per month. No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Court ordered defendant to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on probation, or serve 30 days in the HOC, consecutive. Pay all supervision fees. Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

timeConds.notes: IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE. To be used by the agent for any violations. Defendant shall serve 10 days for the first violation, 20 days for the second violation, and the balance of the condition time for the third violation.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dustin M Wellnitz in court with attorney Benjamin J Peirce.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  

AS TO THE AMENDED INFORMATION:

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction.  Court gives credit for 4 days served. 

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 1 YEAR with the following conditions:

Court does not oppose to probation being transferred to Green Lake.

- 6 MONTHS, IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations.  Defendant shall serve 10 days for the first violation, 20 days for the second violation, and the balance of the condition time for the third violation.
- AODA assessment and satisfactorily completion of any recommended treatment.  Defendant shall be in some type of aftercare program unless agent states he can stop.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.  Defendant shall be tested at least once per month.  
- Maintain full time employment, school, or a combination of both.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Complete 30 hours of community service at a non profit agency.
- Court ordered defendant to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on probation, or serve 30 days in the HOC, consecutive.  
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw

Received and filed.  

Count 2:  Possession of prescription drug without a valid prescription, contrary to WI Stats sec. 450.11(7)(h), 450.11(9)(a).  A unclassified misdemeanor.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defendant to be drug tested today, and was not able to provide a specimen.  Court reminds defendant to stay clean, and that he must provide a specimen when ordered.   Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription, no dangerous weapons or firearms, and no drug parphernalia.  Court increases defendants supervision to ENHANCED with Justice Point.  aw

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dustin M Wellnitz in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Dustin M Wellnitz in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FIORENZA, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
